title: Elimination of cardiac arrhythmias using oral taurine with L-arginine
summary: Patients with frequent premature atrial/ventricular contractions received 10–20 g taurine + 4–6 g L-arginine daily; ectopy markedly reduced. Not a controlled AF trial.

title: Taurine prevents electrical remodeling in acetylcholine–CaCl2 induced atrial fibrillation rats
summary: Taurine shortened AF duration and prevented electrical remodeling by normalizing ion-channel mRNA and potassium levels.

title: Taurine reverses atrial structural remodeling in acetylcholine–CaCl2 induced atrial fibrillation rats
summary: Taurine reduced atrial fibrosis, inflammation and dilation in chronic AF rats, suggesting protection against structural remodeling.

title: Restoring autonomic balance in an atrial fibrillation rat model
summary: Taurine restored autonomic (sympatho-vagal) balance and reduced arrhythmia vulnerability after myocardial injury.

title: Therapeutic effects of a taurine‑magnesium coordination compound
summary: A taurine–magnesium complex reduced arrhythmia incidence and stabilized cardiac electrical activity.

title: Sulfur‑containing amino acids and atrial remodeling (review)
summary: Reviews preclinical evidence that taurine may inhibit atrial fibrosis and oxidative stress—key pathways in AF. No human AF RCTs yet.

title: Sodium nitroprusside reduces postoperative atrial fibrillation after CABG
summary: Intraoperative NO donor lowered AF incidence from 27% to 12% and shortened duration in CABG patients—supports NO pathway relevance.

title: Myocardial L‑citrulline and L‑arginine depletion in aged AF mice
summary: Aged AF mice showed reduced cardiac citrulline/arginine vs. adults, linking impaired NO metabolism to AF substrate.

title: Plasma citrulline increases after successful AF ablation
summary: Citrulline levels rose post-ablation, suggesting association with restored sinus rhythm (correlative, not interventional).

title: Systematic review of L‑citrulline supplementation and cardiovascular effects
summary: Oral citrulline increases plasma arginine and NO bioavailability and improves vascular function; no direct AF outcome trials.
